definition: to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
to change/to alter/to transform/to correct
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: An important political event in King Hui of Liang was his change of Yuan to Post Yuan.
sentences.chinese: 梁惠王改元爲“後元”是他政治生涯中的大事。

definition: reign title/era name (name for either the entire reign of an emperor or one part of it)/year number (such as 2016 or 甲子)
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
to succeed to the throne/accession
to succeed to a title/to inherit
to hand down an imperial edict
the Xin dynasty (8-23 AD) of Wang Mang 王莽, forming the interregnum between the former and later Han
to ascend the throne
to abdicate (as king)
to ascend the throne
to accept abdication
to succeed to the throne
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
to abdicate/to resign a position
posthumous honorific name
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
imperial throne
